We spent the majority of this year and last cooking and eating at home, and while we’re so sick of staring into our fridges, we did learn some valuable lessons about our mental and physical health along the way. For the first episode of our six-episode Healthyish series, Amanda Shapiro is joined by BA senior food editor Christina Chaey, who recently wrote about redefining “healthy” for herself, and dietitian and food equity advocate Vanessa Rissetto, to talk about what those lessons were and how we’re cooking (or not cooking) now.ContentThis content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.Stuff we talk about in this episodeChristina Chaey on “redefining health”Julia Turshen on coming to peace with her bodyChristina Chaey on cooking lessVanessa Rissetto’s Bon Appétit interviewChristina Chaey’s Fridge Clean-Out Donabe recipeAmanda’s current favorite snackChaey’s current favorite snackHow to ListenListen to this episode through the audio player on this page, or subscribe via Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher, Google Podcasts, or wherever you get your podcasts to get all six episodes.
